name: Chili Pepper Boats
preparation: Heat oil in a large Multipurpose Pot over medium heat. Add beef and cook, using Ground Meat Separator to break up chunks, until beef is browned, 3–4 min. Drain excess fat.
Stir in seasoning, beans, tomatoes, and water. Simmer 12–15 min, stirring occasionally.

Meanwhile, cut peppers in half lengthwise; scrape out and discard seeds. Arrange peppers in a Multipurpose Steamer; it’s OK if they overlap. Cover; microwave on high until tender, 4 min 30 sec. Stir halfway through cooking.
To serve, place peppers on plates. Top with chili—they will be full! Add toppings, if desired.
tips: Swap ground meat for two cans (19 oz/540 ml each) of lentils. They’re cooked already, so simply heat in pan with a little oil or water, then continue with Step 2 in the recipe.
Swap Cha Cha Chili Seasoning for Chili or Fajita Seasoning.
perfectlyBalanceYourPlate: Serve with 2 cups leafy greens and 1 tbsp Epicure Salad Dressing, your choice.
